result.execSummary:
The defendant Deandre J Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample. Pay DNA surcharge, all costs, surcharges and disbursements.  To be paid from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance as condition of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED.  Seek and maintain employment.
Mental health assessment. Follow any treatment regiment.

No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for his mental or physical nees. Take as prescribed and only for as long as deemed medically necessary.
No alcohol.

Be given parenting classes/counseling.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; further advised of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deandre J Perry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 17, Judge Stark.
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (53 pages) commencing on 05-09-2014 PLEA AND SENTENCING received and filed.
Defense Andrew Golden telephoned the court requesting an adjournment of the Scheduling Conference due to death in the family. Case adjourned to 05-15-2014 at 08:30 am in Branch 26.

Attorney Andrew J. Golden in court, defendant Deandre J Perry not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held.  Court will allow transfer of case to Br. 20 if acccept for global resolution.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Email sent to clerk advising that the parties have requested that this case be transferred to Branch 20 for global resolution with the lower-pending case, 13CF4305.  Branch 20 has no objection to taking newer case if Branch 26 approves.  Copy of email in 13CF4305. rn
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #13CF4305 and Sheboygan County case #12CF612 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Lindsey Peters-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch Pocan.

Defendant Deandre J Perry in court with attorney Andrew J. Golden.  Defendant Deandre J Perry in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deandre J Perry in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Deandre J Perry in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
